column1: Congress needs to put together a bipartisan #COVID19 relief package before the end of the year.   In my interview w/ @FoxBusiness' @CherylCasone we discuss how @HouseGOP has tried to hold a vote to extend the #PaycheckProtectionProgram yet @SpeakerPelosi keeps shutting us down. https://t.co/2c65Ogny7c

As we gather for #Thanksgiving I'm incredibly grateful for all of our emergency responders health care workers senior caregivers and public servants who have worked tirelessly to defeat #COVID19.   On behalf of our family we want to wish you a Happy Thanksgiving. https://t.co/cqUezWvzAM

Americans have waited months for the next round of #COVID19 relief but @SpeakerPelosi continues to play political games.  Instead of working with @HouseGOP Speaker Pelosi has blocked @HerreraBeutler’s discharge petition to hold a vote to extend the #PaycheckProtectionProgram. https://t.co/pzB7cbvWkd

Throughout the #COVID19 pandemic we've seen a troubling trend of state leaders leaning on #religious institutions harder than any other group or organization.  The liberties enshrined in the #Constitution still apply to every American even in the middle of a national emergency. https://t.co/o9q1HD3fjU

We need #bipartisan leadership in the House to provide critically needed #COVID19 relief to central Arkansans.    We must extend and expand the #PaycheckProtectionProgram ease #PPP forgiveness and provide states with more flexibility to spend #CARESAct funding as they see fit. https://t.co/nkOn3yfen3

This morning I spoke with @BloombergTV’s @TomKeene and @flacqua about how @HouseGOP and @SenateGOP will continue to seek out ways to promote the growth of our nation especially finding long-term solutions to overcome the health and economic crisis brought on by #COVID19. https://t.co/0cGSD8AVV8

I am very encouraged and hopeful by the news of another potential #COVID19 vaccine.   With a safe and effective vaccine we can:   ✅Get Arkansans back to work   ✅Re-open local and small businesses   ✅Safely educate our children in school   https://t.co/Wc1WGPH18M

.@HouseGOP is focused on passing legislation that will address the problems created by #COVID19.   Since May @SpeakerPelosi and @HouseDemocrats have refused to work on a #bipartisan COVID relief bill that would help #Arkansas families workers and small businesses.   #LetsWork https://t.co/ViSyudRMnH

Recently I took to the House Floor to recognize James “Skip” Rutherford the dean of @ClintonSchool. He postponed his plan to retire this year to help students faculty and staff weather #COVID19. Obviously he is extremely dedicated to the people with whom he works. https://t.co/wCFJ8RO1eq

This week I toured the @Walmart Distribution Center in Searcy with Senator John Boozman.  As the employer of over 1100 #Arkansans the center is a vital economic driver in our community.   I commend all of Arkansas's manufacturers' adaptability in the wake of #COVID19. https://t.co/oSaMUFZN4y

During #COVID19 I have been in continuous communication with our officers. This week @JohnBoozman @SteveScalise and I participated in a roundtable discussion with @SCSOArkansas.  I thank all those who participated for their insight into how we can support their work in #AR. https://t.co/9MeCENI2rq

This week with Sen @JohnBoozman I toured @VircoInc in Conway. While usually they supply schools with furniture because of #COVID19 Virco has shifted to meet homeschooling needs. I am proud of all the manufacturers in Arkansas whose products help families during the pandemic. https://t.co/3LyMalLCPK

Today @JohnBoozman @RepLizCheney and I visited the @SearcyPD office to learn how we can support #Arkansas community #police efforts to build trust head off addiction and keep themselves and the public safe during the #COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/zzR4ac6Ev4

Today @RepLizCheney @SenTomCotton @JohnBoozman and I visited the largest processor of COVID-19 tests in Arkansas Unity Health in Searcy for their #HealthcareHeroes Event.   Thank you to all health care workers for their phenomenal efforts to take care of our community. https://t.co/uMe4WO3ijm

Today I received the @NFIB Guardian of Small Business Award at McLehaney Equipment in Haskell #AR. As a lifelong entrepreneur and previous small business owner I am committed to helping owners and employees of small businesses make it through the #COVID19 public health crisis. https://t.co/1c3FBDONLG

Today my friend Sen @JohnBoozman and I had a roundtable with business leaders from Saline County that are setting the standard for workforce development and helping ensure that we will overcome the challenges created by the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/BWl91IW8Gj
WATCH LIVE NOW: How COVID-19 has impacted our active military and veterans in Arkansas and how my office and the state of Arkansas have responded.   https://t.co/5Tv7nQ9opk

Today I toured @WestrockCoffee's facility where they roast package and distribute their coffee with @JohnBoozman CEO Scott Ford Senior VP Clay Parker and VP Will Ford.    Even during #COVID19 they continue to grow their company and production facility in North Little Rock. https://t.co/jrOtsJCHmW

Today on #FirstRespondersDay we recognize the people who work hard to keep Arkansans healthy and safe especially during #COVID19. In May I thanked some our #firstresponders and medical workers in person.  I invite you to say thank you to a first responder you know today. https://t.co/USj72fY41W

Tomorrow morning at 9:00AM CT I am hosting a Facebook LIVE about #COVID19's impact on active service members and veterans in Arkansas with @ArkansasEDC Director of Military Affairs Col. (RET) Rob “Gator” Ator and my Director of Military and Veteran Affairs David Carnahan. https://t.co/RbgH26DY2L

Recently I recognized the patriotic contributions of Darrell Wood during the COVID-19 pandemic for putting up American flags all around Benton Arkansas.  Darrell's actions have served as a bright light in these trying times and I thank him for his selfless service to his city. https://t.co/3UEwg6c1us

Thank you to everyone who took part in my Veterans Advisory Committee this morning. We focused on how #COVID19 has impacted our heroes manufacturing job opportunities for veterans and my Women's Veteran Initiative.   I am constantly working to serve our #Arkansas #veterans. https://t.co/XLBfapHMQq

October is #BreastCancerAwareness Month but awareness for this disease should be year-round. Unfortunately during #COVID19 diagnoses of breast cancer dropped by 50%.   Now that clinics are opening in #AR it is important to complete your check-ups even if they seem routine. https://t.co/3VkBXt1AUZ
HAPPENING NOW: Join me for my Facebook Live discussion about addressing the opioid epidemic in #Arkansas during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/HmWsd4pn0n

Tomorrow morning at 8:30AM CT I am hosting a Facebook LIVE session about COVID-19’s impact on the opioid epidemic in Arkansas and what our state and federal leaders are doing to combat this terrible scourge. I look forward to hearing from Kirk Lane the Arkansas Drug Director. https://t.co/MsN4j2eDeY

The lack of additional #COVID19 relief is beyond disappointing. Both Republicans & Democrats agree that Congress should assist struggling families & workers by extending the Paycheck Protection Program. @SpeakerPelosi needs to put politics aside & focus on #bipartisan solutions. https://t.co/KQEup46M04

Since the beginning of the #COVID19 pandemic I have helped almost 100 central Arkansans receive a total of nearly $400000 in tax returns.   My team is ready help you. Reach out at https://t.co/VrrmNaC4B1 or call (501) 324-5941. https://t.co/Jzh6dYruOJ

During #NationalWomensBusiness Week we celebrate all of the women whose businesses help strengthen our economy and our community.    In May I met co-owners Debbie Broadway and Vickie Collie of @CandlesCreamAR which is producing hand sanitizer to fill the demand from #COVID19. https://t.co/V4Wl7P9WRc

My team stands ready to help you in any way that we can.   This week in La Opinión Newspaper I wrote about specific resources that my office is providing to help Arkansans get back on their feet in the midst of the #COVID19 pandemic.   https://t.co/tm01nghOo5

So good to visit with @EasterSealsAR members at their inpatient Children’s Rehabilitation Center in #LittleRock.  Their goal is to teach people with disabilities how to manage their conditions and be active in our communities even amid the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/RRPbYJojAe

Glad to join @ARInnovationHub Director Dr. Chris Jones & @ucabears grad student Victoria Mays for a conversation about growing Arkansas's arts community.  I am committed to preserving Arkansas’s arts institutions during the challenges of #COVID19. https://t.co/NV999nnMDF
HAPPENING NOW: Join me for my Facebook LIVE discussion about fostering entrepreneurship and innovation in the face of the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/ofiitHHKX7

Tomorrow at 9:00 AM CT  I am hosting a Facebook LIVE about fostering entrepreneurship and innovation in the face of the #COVID19 pandemic.   I look forward to hearing the perspective of Wayne Miller the Executive Director of the @VentureCenter. https://t.co/4W1TBTeMC6

ANNOUNCEMENT: Rental assistance is available for eligible Arkansans affected by #COVID19. If you lost income and/or your home due to the #coronavirus you should apply for aid through @ARHumanServices.   Find out which groups are providing aid near you: https://t.co/U4lzBONZfZ

If you have a fever cough or shortness of breath OR if you think you have been exposed to #COVID19 testing is available in #Arkansas.     To schedule a test visit the @ADHPIO website below:     https://t.co/nYfHFtGo1A

Praying for President Trump & the First Lady. May this somber moment unite our nation not as Democrats or as Republicans but as Americans. Together we will get through this pandemic & defeat COVID-19. Wishing you both a speedy recovery & our thoughts are with the Trump family.

#COVID19 has been hard on everyone especially families and small business owners. In divided government we must put the American people above political games.   In a vote of 214-207 18 @HouseDemocrats joined @HouseGOP and voted against @SpeakerPelosi’s partisan messaging bill. https://t.co/cs97Kwo617

As the world continues to battle the effects of #COVID19 countries like China have attempted to line their own pockets through lobbying @IMFNews for billions in relief.   I will continue to work with my fellow @FinancialCmte Republicans to draw attention to this flawed process. https://t.co/Q5zntlM6cr

In the era of #COVID19 it’s important that Arkansans get the most out of their healthcare benefit accounts.   Earlier today I provided an update at @DataPathAdmn’s conference about the impact of the CARES Act on employee #healthcare benefits and the need to rebuild our economy. https://t.co/EsorSYh4d2

During the #COVID19 pandemic the American people are looking to their leaders to help get our economy back on track.     Republicans and Democrats need to put aside party divisions & work to aid struggling families.  We need a #bipartisan plan for additional coronavirus relief. https://t.co/430oxg9fvI

(1/4) While we grapple with #COVID19 it is important that the government stay open funded and able to help struggling #Arkansans and #Americans.   Tonight the House of Representatives passed a #ContinuingResolution to fund the federal government through December 11 2020.

This morning I spoke to members of @ConcordiaSummit about the repercussions of #COVID19 in trade and manufacturing across the world.  There must be reciprocity and fairness in trade between the U.S. and China. We will continue working with our allies towards reform of the @WTO. https://t.co/RIbHOL6mp7

Elected officials need to put politics aside and work together to pass #COVID19 relief for struggling families and businesses.      It's time for @SpeakerPelosi and @HouseDemocrats to #GetSerious and stop trying to score political points at the expense of #Arkansas families. https://t.co/fF0Wgtzl8t

Today in the #CongressionalOversightCommission's second hearing I highlighted how #Arkansas is safely navigating #COVID19 while promoting economic stability.   I asked how organizations like the #AR Dept of Finance & Admin can participate in the #MunicipalLiquidityFacility. https://t.co/pNt4lLwjNO

Once again jobless claims are below 1 million.   However there are millions of American families workers and businesses who are suffering because of #COVID19.  Congress must meet in the middle and advance legislation that will restore our way of life and rebuild our economy. https://t.co/73fY8AMD8f

Once again every Senate Democrat led by @SenSchumer has blocked hundreds of billions of dollars in #COVID19 relief to American families & small businesses.  Republicans are leading by legislating to defeat the #coronavirus while @SenateDems are playing games. #GetSerious

The #COVID19 pandemic has been difficult for small businesses and restaurants in #Arkansas.   Today I spoke with local restaurant owners about what they need in the wake of this crisis.   I will continue to advocate for small businesses and push for additional federal relief. https://t.co/36X6o9EQDd

Today I joined @rep_stevewomack @TysonFoods President Dean Banks and Chief Sustainability Officer John Tyson in Springdale to discuss how they have been adapting their supply chains and Human Resources practices to meet needs of #COVID19 and a rapidly changing business world. https://t.co/uN3mN5idkE

Encouraging to see that jobless claims fell below 1 million!  However millions of families workers and businesses are struggling because of the #coronavirus.   Republicans and Democrats need to come together to defeat #COVID19 rebuild our economy and restore our way of life. https://t.co/4FwSxKJmPY

Today I spoke with @BloombergTV about #HurricaneLaura and the need for @SpeakerPelosi to work with @HouseGOP and support a #COVID19 deal that extends the #PaycheckProtectionProgram restores unemployment compensation creates incentives to return to work and assists educators. https://t.co/FrdlHoAJ45

Pleased to join my good friend Senator @JohnBoozman at @UACCM for a socially distanced listening session with #Arkansas healthcare workers about #COVID19 and their challenges with #rural #health #care.  Thank you to @CHIStVincent's Bubba Arnold for moderating today’s discussion. https://t.co/UXeVv2LEx8

There is still important work to be done to reverse the negative impacts of #COVID19. While jobless claims slightly decreased over 1 million Americans still applied for unemployment benefits. Congress should seek #bipartisan solutions to assist struggling families & businesses. https://t.co/TRZDCVOnGA

Congratulations to #AR’s new Securities Commissioner Eric Munson who joined me this afternoon in a discussion w/ @FINRA CEO Robert Cook and @FINRAFoundation Pres Gerri Walsh about protecting yourself financially during #COVID19 with quality investment and savings practices. https://t.co/6Qv2lPiiY1

Pleased @CityLittleRock was awarded two @HUDgov grants to fight homelessness during #COVID19 totaling almost $775k. These funds will help prevent homelessness help the unsheltered find permanent homes and provide vital resources to those on the street. https://t.co/PiJ08o5bGx

I was glad to have the opportunity to thank our healthcare heroes today at @BaptistHealthAR in Conway and to congratulate Laura for being given the Healthcare Hero Award. @JohnBoozman and I heard directly from these professionals what is needed to support them combat #COVID19. https://t.co/dple9na1iY

Initial jobless claims unfortunately rose to 1.1 million last week after 2 weeks of decline.    .@HouseGOP and @HouseDemocrats must provide #bipartisan relief to struggling American families workers and businesses.    Together we will defeat #COVID19 and rebuild our economy. https://t.co/3Co3iiL5Ek

The #coronavirus has created an unprecedented public health and economic crisis.  In my op-ed in the @SalineCourier I wrote about what I have done to keep central Arkansans healthy and financially secure.   If I can help you during this difficult time please call 501-324-5941. https://t.co/fujWLMLkxf

Glad to join @MitchellMcCoy on @KARK4News' @CapitolViewAR to discuss how my #education legislation helps teachers safely transition to distance learning and virtual instruction.   We also talked about the need for common sense #COVID19 relief and my latest #GoldenFleeceAward. https://t.co/h9Rcswto7e

In order to defeat #COVID19 and restore our way of life Republicans and Democrats need to meet at the negotiating table and develop a #bipartisan plan of action.   Let's put our differences aside meet in the middle and address the needs of the American people. https://t.co/gUQKnhTftO

The next round of #COVID19 relief should:  -Have another round of #EconomicImpactPayments -Resolve issues surrounding #unemployment compensation -Make sure that our schools have the proper funding -Extend the #PaycheckProtectionProgram  Let's meet in the middle and get this done. https://t.co/GkMbWStLBh

U.S. weekly jobless claims fell below 1 million for the first time since the #COVID19 pandemic began!  Republicans and Democrats must continue to work together to defeat the #coronavirus rebuild our economy and provide relief to struggling workers and businesses. https://t.co/EnI2U5Sl2z

Happy to virtually meet with leaders at the @AR_Conductor for #CongressionalStartUpDay. They are helping build central Arkansas’s reputation as one of the top innovation hubs in the south and have been helping businesses overcome the challenges created by #COVID19. #FullSteamAR https://t.co/mGSzygL2S1

The @VentureCenter continues to help early-stage companies grow into successful businesses even through #COVID19. In celebration of #CongressionalStartUpDay I was glad to hear from business leaders and leaders of the Venture Center how we can best support our job creators. https://t.co/WVlud5Lj8k

Today @HUDgov announced Arkansas has been given over $5 million with over $1 million to central Arkansas in #CARESAct funding to help families who rely on public housing. Supporting those in need helps us all to regain financial stability after the #COVID19 crisis.

I am pleased that St. Francis House in Little Rock has been awarded a $2.14 M grant by the @DeptVetAffairs.   Before #COVID19 my veterans team visited St. Francis House regularly to offer help to veterans. We have seen over the years the excellent work they do for our heroes.

My colleagues and I are working to rebuild our economy & protect Americans from the #coronavirus. In July's #JobsReport the U.S. economy added nearly 1.8 million jobs & the unemployment rate fell to 10.2 percent. The #PaycheckProtectionProgram is working. https://t.co/No3rhEhGiO

Encouraging to see that the @FederalReserve's actions and the CARES Act have provided relief to struggling workers and businesses.   Republicans and Democrats must continue to work together to defeat #COVID19 and restore our economy so we can return safely to our lives. https://t.co/fKBOX8qCs1

Now is the time to learn how to use technology to make your life – and the world – better.   During the #COVID19 pandemic @CALibrarySystem is offering free virtual technology classes for everyone.   Learn more about these "Digital Literacy" courses: https://t.co/4wnNZbld9R

Tune in at 6:10 PM for a telephone town hall I am hosting to answer your questions about Congress' efforts to support #Arkansas families who have been negatively impacted by #COVID19.   If you do not receive a call you can dial 855-859-7298 or watch on Facebook LIVE. https://t.co/xxhu6iv4XN

Tomorrow night at 6:10 PM CT I will be hosting a telephone town hall to answer your questions about Congress’ efforts to support #Arkansas families who have been negatively impacted by #COVID19.  If you do not receive a call you can dial 855-859-7298 or watch on Facebook LIVE. https://t.co/OZ3oXt0FIn

Once again @SpeakerPelosi has charged ahead with a spending package that does nothing more than appease her far-left acolytes.   H.R. 7617 does not prioritize the values of hardworking taxpaying #Arkansas families who are struggling due to #COVID19.  https://t.co/rTBBiig4nW

Happy to join @DavidAsmanfox on @foxbusiness’ @AftertheBell this afternoon to discuss Congress’s next steps to bolster the economy and combat this virus which I believe should be to give states the flexibility in spending #CARESAct funding as they need to fight #COVID-19. https://t.co/MV6fsV8wdr

Tonight @RepMarkTakano and I represented the US Congress in  Trilateral Dialogue b/t legislators from the US #Japan & #SouthKorea facilitated by @MansfieldFDN & @J_USFC. We discussed our nations’ struggles and successes fighting #COVID19 + important regional security issues. https://t.co/KLa4peFpTV

I spoke with @BloombergRadio’s @DavidWestin today about what steps Congress should take to help Americans who have been negatively impacted by #COVID19. We also discussed how my legislation the HELP Act would assist principals and teachers as they prepare for the upcoming year. https://t.co/BvxA6QffpW

I am proud of Hassan Sardar a @pulaskiacademy student. He is delivering letters to @uamshealth doctors facing the stress of #COVID19.  Help him reach his goal of 500 letters by mailing one to PO Box 13624 Maumelle AR 72113 or messaging his Insta account at @letterstodoctors_. https://t.co/OkLZLtL6sM

Less than 30 minutes until my telephone town hall begins!   Call 855-859-7298 to share your thoughts about the upcoming school year and Congress' response to #COVID19.   You can also tune in on Facebook Live. https://t.co/6vuS4eZBjI

Today I joined @KatyTurNBC and @ChuckTodd on @MSNBC to discuss the next round of #COVID19 funding and the lack of sufficient testing reagents as highlighted in the #Arkansas delegation's letter to @VP Mike Pence earlier this month. https://t.co/HnyjuAJyku

Many of you have reached out to discuss the upcoming school year and Congress’ response to #COVID19.   To answer your questions I will be hosting a telephone town hall tomorrow night at 7:30 PM CT.   You can participate by calling 855-859-7298 or by joining me on Facebook LIVE. https://t.co/vuJUUE1OE2

Due to #COVID19 museums across #Arkansas have had to close their doors to visitors but I encourage you to explore their websites and social media accounts.   .@Helenamuseum recently showcased an amazing quilt that @librarycongress Dr. Hayden and I admired several years ago. https://t.co/LwaUNwU0JG

Given how hard the Northeast was hit in the early days of the #COVID19 pandemic it’s very encouraging to see New York's manufacturing sector return to pre-pandemic levels in  July as the regional economy continued to reopen.  https://t.co/pCItd3dnPN

#Small #businesses are the backbone of central #Arkansas and have been tremendously impacted by #COVID19.   Positive sign from @NFIB: small-business owners reported that they are feeling more confident about the U.S. economy. https://t.co/5uoNUiQKKN

(1/3) On Tuesday afternoon I attended Governor @AsaHutchinson’s round table discussion.   Our socially distant conversation focused on how #lawmakers #hospitals #educators #religious organizations and #businesses can address the challenges created by #COVID19 in #Arkansas. https://t.co/ChGYB5vK5A

Wearing a mask is inconvenient but it's critical for our nation’s victory over the #coronavirus. Each of us has a responsibility to do our part. Today I joined Gov. @AsaHutchinson speaking about the #Arkansas delegation's efforts to protect our friends & families from #COVID19 https://t.co/WvQkq2Bhww

HAPPENING NOW: I am speaking at Gov @AsaHutchinson's press conference about Arkansas's plan to combat #COVID-19.   Click on the link below to watch live:  https://t.co/Ic0AMZseRI https://t.co/TiHRnsCXt0

Today I joined @cvpayne on @FoxBusiness to discuss the #Arkansas delegation’s letter to @VP requesting that the White House #Coronavirus Task Force take action to speed states’ #testing capabilities by ensuring an adequate supply of reagents needed to conduct #COVID19 tests. https://t.co/GcyXIFki1i

#Arkansas hospitals have had their internal testing capacity limited due to a shortage of reagents. Today Sen. @JohnBoozman @SenTomCotton @RepRickCrawford @rep_stevewomack @RepWesterman & I sent a letter to @VP requesting the White House Coronavirus Task Force take action. https://t.co/RHLFXv3g3E

(1/2) #TaxDay is in TWO DAYS!   The federal income tax deadline was pushed back to Wednesday July 15 due to #COVID19.   If you have yet to file @IRSnews is advising taxpayers to file electronically. If you are due a refund they also request choosing the direct deposit option.

(1/2) This afternoon I met with @BryantPD’s Captain JW Plouch Student Resource Officer Paul Tarvin and Police Chief Carl Minden as well as @aescottus. We talked about their efforts to protect the people of Bryant and how to address the needs of their officers during #COVID19. https://t.co/8Rc56jQeuA

This afternoon I met met with Sheriff Rodney Wright from @SCSOArkansas.  We discussed efforts being made to keep #central #Arkansas and the law enforcement officers who protect her safe during this #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/D8fai7YfyI

The number one thing we can do as a nation would be to follow CDC guidelines and wear a mask to reduce spreading the #coronavirus.  I appreciated @TomKeene’s and @flacqua’s questions this morning on @BloombergTV about how #Arkansas should to respond to the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/SVHroCGmx3

(2/2) At this morning's socially distant #round #table with the @FBI @DEAHQ @NLRPD @LRPolice @USPISpressroom and other city county and state #law #enforcement officers we discussed the best practices to keep #Arkansans safe. https://t.co/zmv8b42GGM

#Contact #tracing is used by health departments to prevent the spread of #COVID19.  If you have been exposed calls will come from 877-272-6819. @ADHPIO   Be aware of scams: Contact tracers will not ask you for information about your bank account and they will not call after 8pm. https://t.co/m1DVAMKc8U

No matter how dangerous #COVID19 may be it will never alter the fabric of what makes our nation great: faith family and freedom.  Like all challenges that we faced in the past we will come through this better as one nation under God.  My op-ed in today's @SalineCourier: https://t.co/N1oEF6TwP5

Enjoyed discussing solutions for #telehealth benefits especially #ruralbroadband connectivity which impacts many rural Arkansans with @TheJayBir on @CapitolViewAR. Addressing these challenges will provide lasting improvements for #Arkansas way beyond the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/Qk9eOkrkN7

TODAY: The Arkansas Department of Health @ADHPIO will host a free pop-up #COVID19 testing clinic. No screening is required and anyone can get tested. Visit St. Theresa's Catholic Church located at 6219 Baseline Road from 8:00 AM to 2:00 PM whether or not you have symptoms. https://t.co/1hcZaH3jb8

(1/2) My priority is getting healthcare services to as many Arkansans as possible. As I have seen with the spread of #COVID19 across our state the increased use of telehealth services can be a valuable tool for keeping #Arkansans healthy particularly in underserved areas.

To date 5 #Arkansas distilleries including @rocktowndistill in Little Rock are producing hand sanitizer to combat #COVID19. This #CraftSpiritWeek I want to recognize our local distilleries and breweries for their contributions against this virus and to our local economy. https://t.co/aZYNqbVQ6V

If you are healthy and able I encourage you to support our central #Arkansas community by giving blood!   Every donation matters and every donation helps save lives.  Donation centers like @RedCross and @ABIblood have measures in place to help prevent the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/d9VioAa2GZ

(2/5) Earlier this week 78 Members of Congress and I sent a letter to @SpeakerPelosi and @GOPLeader McCarthy asking that Congress provides the @USDA with $51 million in emergency #COVID19 relief funding to the Gus Schumacher Nutrition Incentive Program (GusNIP). https://t.co/bEvnzqcq2P

(2/7) Normally I would be celebrating #Juneteenth with my friends at the #BigelowRosenwaldSchool but these celebrations have been cancelled due to #COVID19. However this gives me the chance to reflect on this important gathering place for African Americans. https://t.co/tA69nSQ7NO

The Paycheck Protection Program has made it possible for #Arkansans keep their jobs and provide for their families.   Today I spoke with @YahooFinance about the need for greater transparency of the program and the next steps in combating the economic crisis caused by #COVID19. https://t.co/fn1tk16cBf

I asked the Chair of the @federalreserve Jerome Powell what he considers to be appropriate levels for our nation’s balance sheet in the wake of the #COVID19 public health and economic crisis. Click below to watch Chairman Powell’s answer in regards to the Fed. https://t.co/bYf0gi1XXd

Thank you to Bettina Randle President of the #Arkansas Homeless Coalition and all the members who joined our discussion about how #homeless #shelters and providers are adapting to #COVID19.   We discussed the challenges that they are facing and what to anticipate in the future. https://t.co/HCqFewTpUm

.@Dillards Fulfillment Center in Maumelle Arkansas continues to meet customer needs in spite of the ongoing #COVID19 public health crisis. Thank you Bill Dillard III Tony Bolte Marty Martin and Tony Arnold for hosting State Rep. Mark Lowery State Sen. Jane English and me. https://t.co/NBOeFep7fb

I recognized the three teams of Central #Arkansas Veterans System staff who assisted the Southeast Louisiana Veterans Healthcare System during the initial surge of #COVID19 in April. I commend their compassion clinical expertise and commitment to our veterans. #HometownHeroes https://t.co/cEQDzWJeO2

I am glad that @KATVNews featured a true American hero – an Arkansas #WWII veteran and #COVID19 survivor SSG John W. Jones (ret.) who is turning 102 tomorrow. Proud to have honored his service and presented him with an American flag to celebrate. https://t.co/xEsBCPGjmR

#WWII veteran and #COVID19 survivor John W. Jones celebrates his 102nd birthday tomorrow.   I was proud to give this American hero an early birthday present by presenting him with an American flag 🇺🇸 flown over Bagram Airbase. His son Donald Jones accepted on his behalf. https://t.co/vVmvnxQIU8

(8/8) We all must work together and continue to move forward with a thoughtful and effective approach to combating the #coronavirus that takes into account the challenges facing all Americans including those in need of mental health services.

(6/8) Additionally @RepCindyAxne (D-IA) @RepBalderson (R-OH) and I introduced H.R. 6654 the Emergency COVID-19 Telehealth Response Act to make sure that clinical social #workers can be #reimbursed for providing their #therapy services via telehealth.

(5/8) #Congress has taken steps to address the mental health challenges posed by COVID-19. On March 27 2020 with my support Congress passed the CARES Act which included $425 million for @samhsagov and loosened restrictions on the use of telehealth in #Medicare.

(2/8) Staying at home can bring intense feelings of #loneliness and exacerbate mental health issues. In addition the economic repercussions of #COVID19 can bring about feelings of #hopelessness. Tragically increased anxiety has increased the rates of #suicide in past crises.

(1/8) Many of us are practicing social distancing as a way to protect ourselves and our families from #COVID19. The space we put between ourselves and our neighbors may be protecting us physically but as a result mental health across #Arkansas and the nation has suffered.
